posts.cooked:
as an inspriration of this poll https://community.signalusers.org/t/platform-bring-the-app-to-harmonyos-next/64764/5?u=zetabeta. i decided to have slightly wider poll.

which of these operating systems are spyware? note: multiple selection poll. you may select ‚Äúnone‚Äù, because poll requires minimum of one selection.

  • Android with google components
  • ungoogled Android, LineageOS, CalyxOS, GrapheneOS, etc.
  • IOS, Iphone
  • HarmonyOS
  • Windows 11/10 and server
  • MacOS
  • linux distribution, generic (not android), fedora, debian, linuxmint, EndeavourOS, opensuse, etc.
  • ChromeOS
  • FreeBSD (not MacOS or IOS)
  • none
0 voters

linux distribution, generic (not android), fedora, debian, linuxmint, EndeavourOS, opensuse, etc.

posts.cooked: i decided not to count MacOS as spyware, as of now. however, MacOS is now totally controlled by apple inc, so it is serious hindrance. macs probably get worse in the future. so, i have precautions.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: my judgement is that macOS respects quite well the ‚Äúdon‚Äôt track me‚Äù setting, it‚Äôs just that tracking is enabled by default and that tracking is quite bad, and people tend to keep the defaults.

posts.name: Chris
posts.cooked: Based on everything I know about it, ChromeOS is one of the only actual offenders here by its nature. The rest is just perception bias and getting a PC or mobile device from a boutique or store that‚Äôs whole purpose is to squeeze as much cash and data out of you as possible unless you take care of things yourself.

even i think it is more or less perception issue. word ‚Äúspyware‚Äù is rather strong word for this. maybe ‚Äúunwanted data collection‚Äù would be better, but still something which goes too far and has invasive intent.
posts.edit_reason: Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.

posts.cooked:
I used to think similarly, but after learning about the telemetry being so easily toggled off (as it is in ChromiumOS), the only iffy part I still see is the lack of local accounts.

Given how much more secure ChromeOS is than other desktop operating systems (especially traditional Linux distros), and the telemetry essentially being identically optional to the open source version, what did you find that made you shudder? (Asking because I‚Äôm not an expert here and genuinely may be oblivious)
